gov.usgs.locator

Class Cratons

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.usgs.locator.Cratons

  • public class Cratons
extends java.lang.Object
    Keep track of the geographic boundaries of continental cratons. Both travel times and magnitudes are sensitive to the age and stability of the crust. For example, in cratons, Pg and Pb are distinct phases and mbLg is a preferred magnitude. In active areas, Pb is an extension of Pg instead of a distinct phase and Ml is preferred.
    Author:
    Ray Buland

      • add

        public void add(java.lang.String region,
                double[] lats,
                double[] lons)
        Add a new craton.
        Parameters:
        region - Region name
        lats - Geographic latitude points defining the boundary polygon of the craton
        lons - Geographic longitude points defining the boundary polygon of the craton

      • isCraton

        public boolean isCraton(double latitude,
                        double longitude)
        Determine if an epicenter is inside a craton.
        Parameters:
        latitude - Geographical epicenter latitude in degrees
        longitude - Geographical epicenter longitude in degrees
        Returns:
        True if the epicenter is inside a craton
